member.name: IDockingWindowSite.GetBorderDW
member.summary: Gets the border space allocated for the specified object.
member.param: Pointer to the object for which the border space is being requested.

Pointer to a structure that, when this method returns successfully, receives the entire available border space for the browser. The docking window object should use this information to determine where to place itself. See the method for more information.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDockingWindowSite.RequestBorderSpaceDW
member.summary: Approves, modifies, or refuses a request for an object's border space. The border space is not allocated until the method is called.
member.param: Pointer to the object for which the border space is being requested.

A pointer to a BORDERWIDTHS structure. Before calling this method, the structure must be filled with the desired border space. After the method returns successfully, the structure contains the approved border space. The object may change these values. If border space is critical, it is the caller's responsibility to determine if the returned border space is sufficient.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the border space request is approved or modified, or an error value otherwise.

member.name: IDockingWindowSite.SetBorderSpaceDW
member.summary: Allocates and reserves border space for an object.
member.param: A pointer to the object for which the border space is being set.

A pointer to a BORDERWIDTHS structure that contains the coordinates of the object's border space. The border space should be approved through a successful call to the method before SetBorderSpaceDW is called with these coordinates.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDockingWindowSite
member.summary: Exposes methods that manage the border space for one or more objects. This interface is implemented by the browser and is similar to the interface.
